item.title: Latest Titanfall 3 Rumors “Not Real”, According To Jeff Grubb
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/latest-titanfall-3-rumors-not-real-according-to-jeff-grubb/

Don’t get your hopes up for Titanfall 3 just yet. After a leak came out suggesting that Titanfall 3 is “almost complete” along with a number of planned features, one prominent journalist has publicly reported that none of the leaked information is accurate.

In the latest episode of Game Breaking News, Jeff Grubb shot down the claims by Apex Legends leaker Osvaldatore.

“This isn’t real,” Grubb said. “I’m sorry. It’s not real.”

Grubb then went on to talk about Respawn having a small team that is “probably messing around with games that have titans in them”.

“Does he ( Titanfall 1 director Steve Fukuda) have something like a prototype that has titans in it? I would guess so,” Grubb added. “I don’t know for sure, but I would certainly assume that that is a safe thing to think.

“Now, is that going to get announced in 2025 and released in 2026? No way.”

READ MORE: Xbox Games Showcase Announced For June 8, 2025

He then touched on the fact that EA has been on a trend of canceling various games at Respawn. Those cancellations include Titanfall Legends which was a “previous version of Titanfall 3”.

“Do not expect an Unreal Engine 5, single player campaign Titanfall 3 with a full multiplayer suite,” Grubb said while saying he hated being the one to rain on the parade. “I’m not sure where this is coming from…don’t get your hopes up for Titanfall anytime soon.”

Do you think EA and Respawn will ever release a Titanfall 3? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what Nintendo of America’s president had to say to people who might not be able to afford a Nintendo Switch 2. And don’t forget to sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows is Already Winning Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/assassins-creed-shadows-winning-awards/

Assassin’s Creed Shadows was released on March 20 to a reception that nobody expected. It was lauded in the press, and the reviews were pretty stellar on a universal scale, and then the game went on to sell millions of copies. That performance and the ultimate delivery of the game have led many to believe that it’s a turning point for the series.

It hasn’t been a single month since Assassin’s Creed Shadows hit the market, and it’s already winning awards… Kind of.

Voice of the Players

Assassin’s Creed Shadows is the winner of PlayStation’s Players’ Choice for March. It was voted the best game of the month based on the results of a poll on the PlayStation Blog, which is about as official as it gets.

Admittedly, the competition wasn’t all that strong in March, except the smash hit Hazelight game, Split Fiction.

I think that Assassin’s Creed Shadows will go on to win some prestigious awards this year, as what Ubisoft produced was one of the best games we’ve seen in the series for many years. That’s a sentiment that I echoed in my in-depth review of the game.

Last night, I was fortunate enough to catch up with Masumi (Naoe) at the BAFTA Games Awards, learning more about her role in Assassin’s Creed Shadows and what she thought about the more controversial elements of the game.

It’s not the end of the road for AC Shadows, of course. There is DLC in the pipeline, and Ubisoft is hard at work producing patches to add more quality-of-life improvements, including a recent one that I was desperate for.

Are you still playing Assassin’s Creed Shadows, or have you already moved on and are looking to what comes next? Let me know in the comments or hit up the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out my interview with Neil Newbon about AI in gaming

item.title: All Prison Safe Locations in Warzone Verdansk
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-prison-safe-locations-in-warzone-verdansk/

Completing the Return to Verdansk event requires players to open safes in every area of the map. With that in mind, here are all the safe locations in Prison.

The Return to Verdansk event started on April 3 and runs through April 15. Unlike other events in Black Ops 6 that could be completed in multiplayer or battle royale matches, this one can only be completed in Warzone on Verdansk.

Your loadout weapons will make completing this event easier, as they are much better than what you find from ground loot. So, check out which loadouts are the best in Season 3, including the HDR and CR-56 AMAX, before starting this challenge.

Every Warzone Verdansk Safe Location in Prison

In the Return to Verdank event, the objective is to open one safe in each of Verdansk’s 12 zones. In the Prison zone, there are nine safes. Despite the POI being nestled in the bottom right corner of the map, Prison is a hot drop, and it will be challenging to open a safe without facing some opposition.

The image below shows where all of the safes are. After opening one, you can move on to the next zone. However, even after opening one, there is still an incentive to open more because each safe has a chance of unlocking Caine’s rare Trail Blazer operator skin.

Warzone Return to Verdansk Rewards

Each Zone has a different reward in the Return to Verdansk event. To unlock the Kali Sticks, you must acquire all 12 zone rewards.

Superstore, Prison, Stadium, and Hospital will be the most challenging zones to open a safe in because those POIs always attract a lot of players when a match first starts. In addition, it will take at least a few matches to complete this event, as the closing circle limits how many zones you can reach in one match.

And even when other players have completed every zone, safes will always be hotly contested throughout the event because everyone wants the rare operator skin.

Here are all 12 zones and rewards.

That’s everything you need to know about opening safes on Prison for the Return to Verdansk event. With that out of the way, Call of Duty fans have much to look forward to. CoD MW2 and MW3 were reportedly rated in Australia, hinting at potential remasters. Rumors also suggest that the next CoD title will launch with six fully-fledged Zombies maps.

Are you enjoying the Verdansk remake? Check out the Insider Gaming Forums if you want to share a wild Warzone moment.
